content.description: Great holds along the whole route. The crux is pulling up over a large overhang with limited feet.
content.protection: Two pine trees for top rope anchors at the top
content.location: This is to the right of the bolted 5.9 bo diddley route. It is nearly in front of you when you first arrive at the climbing area.

content.description: The is a route with great stone jugs. The crux is climbing up and over a nose of rock that juts over a cave. You can take a breather in the cave before tackling this crux.
content.protection: Use two pine trees at top of route to set up a top rope.
content.location: This route is to the right of Bo Diddley. It is near where the trail meets the climbing area. Start at the lowest point of rock and then go to the left of the pine tree in the route. Then climb up over the nose of rock.

content.description: Heads up an obvious wide crack system to a low angle slab, stay left up the arete for the original route, or head right into the dihedral to finish at a solid tree anchor.
content.location: left of the mostly blank face (local legend 5.11d).

content.description: Right leaning crack system works up to the right of a large detached block. tree anchor on the first ledge.
content.location: 20ft left of Jagged Edge, just around the corner from the scramble to the top (First Day Face 5.3?).

content.description: The only fully bolted route on this wall. The crux is pulling through a bulge between the 2nd and 3rd bolts. The beta can be a little tricky to figure out on lead. Like everything else on this wall, following the cliffbreak trail will take you to the top where good tree's can anchor a top rope.
content.location: Turn left at the cliffbreak sign, the route starts just to the right of a deep roof.

content.description: Older more established climbing section of Rattlesnake Ridge in the northeast section of the area.
